title: Is Richard Wilkins headed to Hollywood? Today Extra host to make his acting debut
text:
As a veteran entertainment reporter, Richard 'Dickie' Wilkins is no stranger to interviewing Hollywood A-listers.

But it seems Dickie, 65, host may have dreams of becoming an actor himself after interviewing Days Of Our Lives' producer Ken Corday on Today Extra last week.

According to the Sun Herald, Dickie was so pleased with Ken's interview that he asked the producer for a role on the show.

Is Dickie heading to Hollywood? Richard Wilkins 'wants to make his international acting debut on Days Of Our Lives' after interviewing the show's ' producer Ken Corday on Today Extra last week

'He has the perfect hair for a soap star so I wouldn't be surprised if his face pops up on the show in future,' a Nine Network insider told the publication.

And Richard's rumoured gig doesn't seem too far fetched.

Studio 10 entertainment presenter Angela Bishop previously made two cameo appearances on rival show The Bold and the Beautiful in 2017 and 2018.

'He has the perfect hair for a soap star so I wouldn't be surprised if his face pops up on the show in future': According to the Sun Herald , Dickie was so pleased with Ken's interview that he asked the producer for a role on the show

During Dickie's interview with Ken last week, the producer revealed that his favourite storyline on Days Of Our Lives was the controversial demonic possession of Marlena Evans, played by actress Deidre Hall.

Ken revealed: 'Actually when we took Deidre Hall, the lovely Marlena Evans, and had her possessed by the devil. It was right out of The Exorcist!'

The producer went on to admit he was dubious about the plot and at first, having told the writers it wasn't their finest idea.

Richard's dream gig doesn't seem too far fetched! Channel 10's Angela Bishop made two cameo appearances on The Bold and the Beautiful in 2017 and 2018. (Pictured: Angela with co-stars Katherine Kelly Lang, left, Heather Tom, centre)

Iconic: During Dickie's interview with Ken last week, the producer revealed that his favourite storyline on Days Of Our Lives was the controversial demonic possession of Marlena Evans, played by actress Deidre Hall

'The writer called me and said this is what we are going to do. And I said 'you're mad, that will never work!'' Ken admitted.

However he gave them a shot, adding: 'The writer said 'I'll just try it for a few weeks''.

'That was October, we were meant to end it at Christmas, but it went till Easter. It just kept playing and playing!' Ken said with a laugh.
